title: Will renters finally catch a break?
itunes:title: Will renters finally catch a break?
itunes:author: Marketplace / Kai Ryssdal
description: The last few years have been a roller coaster for renters. Though  rents are up roughly 9% year over year, that’s an improvement from the increases seen last year. Is this a sign that the rental market is finally moderating, or just a temporary seasonal dip? Plus, a boost in new car inventory, new pay transparency laws that encourage fair compensation and banks’ role in the racial wealth gap.
